Game Rewind | U of L holds off Cleveland State

The Cards tip off at 7 p.m.

Game Rewind | U of L holds off Cleveland State

You are watching a live video presentation from Courier-Journal.com. If you came in late, you can scrub back on the progress bar on the player. If you arrive here early, you may have to refresh this page if you do not see the live video. Gannett

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 8:59 p.m. EST November 26, 2014

U of L coach Rick Pitino is going for win No. 700 against Cleveland State.(Photo: Jamie Rhodes-USA TODAY Sports)

3 CONNECT 11 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh for updates (or click here) during the University of Louisville's 7 p.m. Wednesday basketball game against Cleveland State at the KFC Yum! Center.

Final: With a 45-33 victory over Cleveland State, U of L's Rick Pitino is now the sixth active coach in college basketball with 700 wins.

For final stats, follow this link: http://bit.ly/1ppdCoh

Watch Pitino's postgame comments in our video player above, or if viewing on a mobile device, head here: http://cjky.it/1GC29Hq

700! Rick Pitino reaches milestone win total in No. 6 Louisville's 45-33 victory over Cleveland State. pic.twitter.com/fS5mdLKHsc

— NCAA March Madness (@marchmadness) November 27, 2014

0:42, 2H: Cleveland State, which has scored 11 points this half, finds itself down 12. Close call for U of L, though the Cards are holding on late. Stick around for full stats...

2:46, 2H: Montrezl Harrell hit a layup to make it 44-33 U of L, and Chris Jones fell to the ground, fouled, heading into the under-four timeout. He'll have free throws after the break. The Cards appear in the clear.

.@MONSTATREZZ being all Montrezl. #L1C4#CardNationpic.twitter.com/rDgEW3hORE

— Scott Utterback (@Utterback13) November 27, 2014

5:04, 2H: It's been Cleveland State's strategy to not allow U of L to run quickly in transition. Trey Lewis missed a 3-pointer, though, and the Cards did just that. Wayne Blackshear nearly made a basket and foul at the other end but instead settled for just a free throw out of a Vikings timeout. It's 42-33.

5:29, 2H: Big shot by Chris Jones. His 3-pointer, the next trip down the court after Cleveland State's 4-0 mini-run, pushed the Cards ahead 41-33. Said Bob Valvano on the ESPN call: "Players make plays."

A new tradition, or just new to me? @GodsGift_3 & all the U of L players gave out fist bumps before the game. #L1C4pic.twitter.com/gRM47fyENC

— Scott Utterback (@Utterback13) November 27, 2014

6:01, 2H: After more than five minutes without a point, Cleveland State got buckets in succession by Aaron Scales and Trey Lewis. Rick Pitino is down to one timeout as the Cards lead 38-33.

6:53, 2H: Terry Rozier made a free throw and rimmed out the second. No worries. 5-10 point guard Chris Jones came up with the rebound, absorbed a foul and made both of his freebies. The Cards have their largest lead of the half -- 38-29.

7:54, 2H: Chinanu Onuaku's 7th block sent this one to the under-eight timeout. It looks to be a grinder to the finish. To U of L's credit, the defense has been there. Cleveland State has missed its last six shots, and the Vikings have all of 7 points in the second half. Score remains 35-29.

#UofL's defense isn't the problem. Has 10 blocks. Cleveland State shooting 27.5.

— Michael Grant (@MichaelGrant_CJ) November 27, 2014

8:20, 2H: Montrezl Harrell made it to the free throw line again, and he again made 1 of 2. That has U of L ahead 35-29, but it could be so much more on a night when the Cards are so far a collective 7 of 18 from the charity stripe.

9:30, 2H: The positive -- Terry Rozier has 8 points and as many rebounds at the guard spot. The negative -- the Cards are now 24 of 100 from 3-point range this season. They lead Cleveland State 34-29, an advantage widened a tad by a Montrezl Harrell free throw.

Would be nice to have another skilled scored to give you a few minutes. What yall up to NCAA?

— Mark Ennis (@MarkEnnis) November 27, 2014

10:22, 2H: This one may be close to the wire. Behind 22 points from guard Trey Lewis, the Vikings are down just two possessions -- 33-29 -- to a U of L team that's blown out a number of similar-caliber opponents.

In the second half, the Cards are 3 of 11 from the field and have hit 1 of 7 3-pointers.

11:13, 2H: If Rick Pitino is to get his 700th win tonight, he'll have to earn it. Pitino just burned his third timeout, the Cards ahead 33-29 and coaching possession by possession.

David Levitch is in for #UofL

— Michael Grant (@MichaelGrant_CJ) November 27, 2014

13:09, 2H: Finally, U of L hit a shot. Terry Rozier's 3-pointer marked the Cards' first bucket since the 17:59 mark.

14:25, 2H: Cleveland State's Andre Yates finally hit a layup. It's the only recent bucket in this one, which U of L leads a whopping 28-26. This game is killing off the transitive property of sports. Savannah State, the team the Cards blew out the other night, actually beat the Vikings 87-83.

15:45, 2H: The lead remains 28-24 into the under-16 media timeout. U of L's off to a 1 of 5 start from the field in the second half and has missed all three of its 3-point attempts.

17:04, 2H: Timeout, U of L. Rick Pitino called for another when Cleveland State guard Trey Lewis, who now has 20 points, scored again on a layup that has the Cards' lead at 28-24. A telling offensive stat? U of L has assisted just two of its 11 field goals tonight.

18:39, 2H: Montrezl Harrell is urging his teammates for better play on the offensive end. U of L, off to an 0 for 3 start from the field this half, still leads 26-22.

20:00, 2H: It's the same five out to start the second half.

Halftime: Terry Rozier missed a 3-pointer, but Montrezl Harrell grabbed a rebound on the opposite side of the bucket and finished to give U of L some breathing room heading into the locker room. The Cards, who have hit 1 of 9 3-pointers and 5 of 14 free throws, are ahead just 26-22 on a 23-point underdog.

#UofL stats as the Cards lead Cleveland State 26-22 at the half: http://t.co/RneglDTRtjpic.twitter.com/OWyKtN4sAi

— Jonathan Lintner (@JonathanLintner) November 27, 2014

1:02, 1H: Butler did beat No. 5 North Carolina. Upsets happen. Perhaps Cleveland State believes. The Vikings have made their last four shots to pull within 24-22 of U of L near the half.

2:10, 1H: The Penn State transfer Trey Lewis hit one more jumper before the media timeout. Luckily for U of L, the Cards got a made bucket from Chris Jones as well. It's 24-19, and Lewis leads all scorers 17 points on 6 of 12 shooting.

2:58, 1H: Trey Lewis, with the defense anticipating another 3-pointer, this time drove the lane and made a tricky layup to again cut into the Cards' lead. Rick Pitino sprung for a timeout ahead 22-17.

4:19, 1H: The only thing working for Cleveland State's offense is Trey Lewis' 3-point shot. Still, he's only 4 of 18. But the last two have the Vikings to within 22-15 of U of L, which is led by Wayne Blackshear's 7 points.

6:15, 1H: Offense is at a premium. Cleveland State has hit 1 of its last 10 shots and 2 of its last 18. U of L's made none of its last 5 and 2 of its last 10. The Cards lead 16-9.

What do you want Trez to do next time he touches the ball? RT: #DUNKL Fav: Shoot a 3 #L1C4

— Louie the Cardinal (@LouietheCard) November 27, 2014

7:29, 1H: A Chinanu Onuaku tip-in capped an 11-1 Cards run, and Cleveland State finally answered with the game's second Trey Lewis 3-pointer. At the under-eight timeout, it's 16-9 U of L. Onuaku has 2 points, 5 rebounds and 4 blocks.

9:53, 1H: Montrezl Harrell swatted a shot. Then Chinanu Onuaku did. Wayne Blackshear secured the rebound, Chris Jones was fouled, and Cleveland State went from a would-be layup to 14-6 deficit thanks to a Jones free throw. The Cards' defense looks stout again.

11:00, 1H: The Vikings, now 2 of 14 from the field, missed another attempt out of their timeout. On the other end, Wayne Blackshear was fouled heading up for a missed alley-oop attempt.

Great graphic showing milestone victories for Coach Pitino. #L1C4#ACCFirstspic.twitter.com/iHQxKWcbze

— Nick Stover (@ULFlyingCard) November 27, 2014

11:21, 1H: Cleveland State has seven fouls and six points. Already, U of L's shooting in the bonus, and though the Vikings aren't getting run out of the building by any means, their coach, Gary Waters, called for a 30-second timeout down 11-6 and approaching the under-12 timeout.

13:03, 1H: Three of Cleveland State's starters -- Anton Grady, Kaza Keane and Marlin Mason -- are on the bench already with a pair of fouls apiece.

13:51, 1H: Terry Rozier came up with a steal and score. The next trip up the court, Wayne Blackshear hit a 3-pointer. Quickly, the Cards have doubled their lead at 10-5. By the way, Quentin Snider is in at point guard for Chris Jones, who's dealing with a sore shin.

15:35, 1H: It's 5-5 at the under-16 timeout with U of L having missed its last three shots. The Cards have points so far from Wayne Blacksear (2), Montrezl Harrell (2) and Terry Rozier (1).

. @JonathanLintner I believe the last time Zollo played here at the KFC Yum! Center was #WKU's NCAA tournament loss to Kentucky in 2012.

— Michael Grant (@MichaelGrant_CJ) November 27, 2014

17:08, 1H: Forward Mason Marlin has already committed two fouls and headed to the bench in favor of Vinny Zollo, a Western Kentucky transfer who has played against the Cardinals before.

18:04, 1H: Is the Cards' defense lacking? We kid, but only because it took Cleveland State fewer than two minutes to score its first points on a Trey Lewis 3-ball.

18:12, 1H: On one end, Montrezl Harrell helped on defense and came up with a block. He dashed down the floor, caught a pass at the top of the key and drove for a basket and foul. The Cards lead 4-0.

18:52, 1H: Not what the Cards wanted to see early. On Cleveland State's first trip down the court, Chinanu Onuaku -- whose backup is essentially just Anas Mahmoud -- committed a foul. Another whistle puts Rick Pitino in an interesting situation.

20:00, 1H: Mangok Mathiang is dressed but won't play for U of L. The Cards' starters are as expected -- Chris Jones, Terry Rozier, Wayne Blackshear, Montrezl Harrell and Chinanu Onuaku.

Coach Pitino striving for a milestone tonight! #ItsGood2Be#CardNation#L1C4#700Winspic.twitter.com/alBIC0hJ5c

— Nick Stover (@ULFlyingCard) November 27, 2014

PREGAME: U of L is a heavy favorite -- listed at -23 versus Cleveland State -- to cap the Global Sports Showcase with another win, which would be Rick Pitino's 700th. Pitino, of course, is one of give active coaches in the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame (four of them are from the ACC).

To pull it off, the Cards would have to win their third game in six days and against a team picked to finish second in the Horizon League. Cleveland State, coming off a 21-12 season, returned four starters, led by guard Trey Lewis, who averaged 16 points per game.

U of L will play shorthanded. Sixth man Mangok Mathiang is out, while Chris Jones, who has a sore shin, should play. More on that here: http://cjky.it/11V1n8R.

For more pregame reading, check out a game preview (http://cjky.it/1Ciut1T) and story lines (http://cjky.it/1FrOilw).

U of L's Projected Starters

G Chris Jones

G Terry Rozier

F Wayne Blackshear

F Montrezl Harrell

C Chinanu Onuaku

Cleveland State's Projected Starters

G Kaza Keane

G Trey Lewis

G Anre Yates

F Marlin Mason

F Anton Grady
